sen.j: 細媛命（くわしひめのみこと）は、欠史八代、孝霊天皇の皇后。
sen.e: Kuwashihime no mikoto was the Empress of Emperor Korei, one of the eight emperors reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
sen.cmt: 欠史八代→定訳不明：Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns)としました。
sen.e: Kuwashihime no mikoto was the Empress of Emperor Korei, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
Kuwashihime no mikoto was the Empress of Emperor Korei, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
She was the real mother of Emperor Kogen.
She was the real mother of Emperor Kogen.
She was the real mother of Emperor Kogen.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』本文における皇后で、磯城県主大目の娘。
sen.e: In the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), she is mentioned as the Empress, and she was the daughter of Shiki no agatanonushi Ome.
In the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), she is mentioned as the Empress, and she was a daughter of Shiki no agatanonushi Ome.
In the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), she is mentioned as the Empress, and she was a daughter of Shiki no agatanonushi Ome.

sen.j: 『古事記』では十市県主祖大目の娘である細比売。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the Empress was Hosohime, the daughter of Ome, who was the ancestor of Tochi no agatanonushi.
sen.cmt: 十市県主→Tochi no agatanonushiとしました。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the Empress was Hosohime, a daughter of Ome, who was an ancestor of Tochi no agatanonushi.
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the Empress was Hosohime, a daughter of Ome, who was an ancestor of Tochi no agatanonushi.

sen.j: なお、『日本書紀』第1の一書での皇后は春日千乳早山香媛（かすがのちちはややまかひめ）。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the alternate writing 1-1, the Empress was Kasuganochichihayayamakahime.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the Nihonshokiとしました。 『日本書紀』→既出なのでthe Nihonshoki としました。 春日千乳早山香媛（かすがのちちはややまかひめ）→Kasuganochichihayayamakahimeとしました。
sen.e: On the other hand, in a first writing in the Nihonshoki, the Empress was Kasuganochichihayayamakahime.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書 --> a first writing in the Nihonshokiと訳出し。
sen.e: On the other hand, the first addendum to the Nihonshoki mentions the Empress was Kasuganochichihayayamakahime.
sen.cmt: in a first writing in→the first addendum to~mentions

sen.j: 第2の一書の皇后は十市県主等の祖である真舌媛（ましたひめ）。
sen.e: While in the alternate writing 1-2, the Empress is Mashitahime, who was the ancestor of Tochi no agatanonushi, and others.
sen.cmt: 第2の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-2'としました。 真舌媛（ましたひめ）→Mashitahime 十市県主等→Tochi no agatanonushi, and othersとしました。
sen.e: While in a second writing, the Empress is Mashitahime, who was an ancestor of Tochi no agatanonushi and others.
sen.cmt: (日本書紀)第2の一書 --> a second writing in the Nihonshokiと訳出し。Ancestorの冠詞をthe からanに変更。
sen.e: However, the second addendum describes the Empress as Mashitahime, who was an ancestor of Tochi no agatanonushi and others.
sen.cmt: in a second writing,→the second addendum describes~as
